content: Offerings for Building the Temple
Furthermore King David said to all the assembly: “My son Solomon, whom alone God has chosen,  young and inexperienced; and the work  great, because the temple  not for man but for the  God.

Now for the house of my God I have prepared with all my might: gold for  gold, silver for  silver, bronze for  bronze, iron for  iron, wood for  wood, onyx stones,  to be set, glistening stones of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and marble slabs in abundance.

Moreover, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house, my own special treasure of gold and silver:
three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses;
the gold for  gold and the silver for  silver, and for all kinds of work  by the hands of craftsmen. Who  is willing to consecrate himself this day to the ?”
Then the leaders of the fathers’  leaders of the tribes of Israel, the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the officers over the king’s work, offered willingly.

They gave for the work of the house of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
And whoever had  stones gave  to the treasury of the house of the , into the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
Then the people rejoiced, for they had offered willingly, because with a loyal heart they had offered willingly to the ; and King David also rejoiced greatly.
David’s Praise to God
Therefore David blessed the  before all the assembly; and David said:
“O  our God, all this abundance that we have prepared to build You a house for Your holy name is from Your hand, and  all Your own.

I know also, my God, that You test the heart and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these  and now with joy I have seen Your people, who are present here to offer willingly to You.
O  God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the intent of the thoughts of the heart of Your people, and fix their heart toward You.
And give my son Solomon a loyal heart to keep Your commandments and Your testimonies and Your statutes, to do all  and to build the temple for which I have made provision.”
Then David said to all the assembly, “Now bless the  your God.” So all the assembly blessed the  God of their fathers, and bowed their heads and prostrated themselves before the  and the king.
Solomon Anointed King(S)

And they made sacrifices to the  and offered burnt offerings to the  on the next day: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, a thousand lambs, with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
So they ate and drank before the  with great gladness on that day. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed  before the   the leader, and Zadok  priest.
Then Solomon sat on the throne of the  as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
All the leaders and the mighty men, and also all the sons of King David, submitted themselves to King Solomon.
So the  exalted Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed on him  royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
The Close of David’s Reign
Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
And the period that he reigned over Israel  forty years; seven years he reigned in Hebron, and thirty-three  he reigned in Jerusalem.
So he died in a good old age, full of days and riches and honor; and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
Now the acts of King David, first and last, indeed they  written in the book of Samuel the seer, in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
with all his reign and his might, and the events that happened to him, to Israel, and to all the kingdoms of the lands.
